definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: You might say he gave virtue a good name.
sentences.chinese: 可以說他賦予美德以美名。

sentences.english: This "urban card "of the peony fair has already spread the graceful name of Luoyang everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 牡丹花會這張“城市名片”已把洛陽的美名四海傳揚。

sentences.english: He won the nickname "Bulldozer" for good reason.
sentences.chinese: 他亦因種種善行得到了“推土機”的美名。

sentences.english: Fog also a folk song in "Dream as" a good reputation.
sentences.chinese: 霧凇在民間還有一個“夢送”的美名。

sentences.english: After surviving the surf, it's time for the rock-hoppers to live up to their name.
sentences.chinese: 渡過猛浪後，它們終於可以不負跳巖者美名。

sentences.english: Life is for one generation, a good name is forever.
sentences.chinese: 生命只一代，美名萬古存。

sentences.english: Hubei, where the Chu Culture originated, is known as "thoroughfare to nine provinces", serves as traffic hub linking all places in China.
sentences.chinese: 湖北是楚文化的發祥地，素有“九省通衢”之美名。

sentences.english: The reputation of Doumen bananas is spreading all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 斗門香蕉的美名正在傳遍全國各地。

sentences.english: Xi Yan has a reputation for excellent service and a nice garden view.
sentences.chinese: 喜宴還因它的優質服務和漂亮花園享有美名。

sentences.english: And Cangzhou has another beautiful name , do you know it?
sentences.chinese: 你知道它還有一個美名嗎？

definition: to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
to acclaim/to sing the praises of
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
to dub with a nice-sounding appellation/fanciful moniker
refined appelation/(humor) sb's elegant monicker/(hon.) your esteemed name
to make a name/to become famous
